linkTarget.anchoringText: Quantitative assessment of the level of uncertainty is to calculate the probability of achieving the levels of P10-P50-P90 on the results of multivariate analysis and risk assessment. The most common such assessments to determine the initial geological reserves and production profiles (Figures 3 and 4).

linkTarget.anchoringText: In this case it is necessary to schedule repetitive research to the next field period or start a fullscale development without reducing any of the key uncertainties. Thus, the production / injection profiles of many deposits are significantly different from the project because at the stage of FPP has not been reliably estimated potential realizable WI system options for developing the system. These two approaches (traditional and optimal graph works) can be illustrated graphically (see. Figure 5).

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Comparison of the traditional and optimal graphs of FPP planning and implementation

linkTarget.anchoringText: A single layer of delayed parasekventsiey, quickly advancing to the deposit area (Figure 6);

linkTarget.anchoringText: The main geological uncertainty is the presence within the formation of wedge-shaped surfaces of unknown distribution that can significantly influence the direction of flow filtration (see Figure 7). The main uncertainty is the largest development of reservoir fluid viscosity and the possibility of implementing an effective system of PPD due to low PFD in the water received in the core. There were identified the main priori uncertainties associated with the facies variability:

7 wells are used in the FPP Plan, including 6 horizontal wells. Schematically well placement relative to each other and study their interaction (initial plan) in order to identify the characteristics of the formation are shown in Figures 8 and 9. The initial plan included the removal of test curves, the pressure recovery curves, 3D Interference, recycling oil.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Scheme of the initial well testing plan, including Interference tests

formatted-caption.caption-text: Scheme of the initial well testing plan, including Interference tests

The initial plan included the removal of test curves, the pressure recovery curves, 3D Interference, recycling oil.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: Placement of wells on the lithology cross-section

formatted-caption.caption-text: Placement of wells on the lithology cross-section

linkTarget.anchoringText: For example, for wells W1 and W4, drilled in different reservoir facies scheduled 12 and 14 days on PRC, respectively. From the perspective of the geological structure of the reservoir uncertainties greatest impact on time-to-radial flow will have a lateral permeability anisotropy. The PRC calculation taken into account lateral permeability uncertainty showed that it must be considered possibility to increase the study duration to 20 and 27 days, respectively; almost 2-fold (Table 4,Figure 10).

Problem of the sensitivity assessment is to model the value and time of the signal response for forward and reverse consequence of chokes in the well-source. Oil production total volume, equals to 980 m3, the number and size chokes, duration of working out on each choke are equal. The simulation results showed that the response value in the well-receiver in both cases will be identical and equal to 0.2 atm, at a faster implementation of signal arrival in the reverse consequence (Figure 11).

image-wrap.label: Figure 11
image-wrap.caption: Example of the Interference test design

formatted-caption.caption-text: Example of the Interference test design
